item.title: [317][Delta]I was adding exp lock [Delta][317]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

What? Delete everything that you did to make that work, mine should work.

Then Open up the Player class, and keep open your client class.

in Player declare this:

public int lockXp = 0;

Close Player.java

And in the client class search up:

} else if (token.equals("character-energy")) { playerEnergy = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Then under it add:

} else if (token.equals("character-lockexp")) { lockXp = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Then find

characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(starter).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Under it add

characterfile.write("character-lockexp = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(lockXp), 0, Integer.toString(lockXp).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Finally search:

public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) {

And under it add:

if (lockXp == 1) { return false; }

There, now THAT should work.

Whenever you want something to lock your exp, use this:

lockXp = 1;

Whenever you want something to unlock your exp, use this:

lockXp = 0;

For example in a method (Don’t use this):

public void lockExp() { sM("Yur exp been locked bro"); lockXp = 1; }

Or in a command (Use this):

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("explock")) { if(lockXp == 0) { lockXp = 1; sM("You lock your exp"); } if(lockXp == 1) { lockXp = 0; sM("You unlock your exp"); } }

If you use the command while your exp is locked it will unlock it, if you use it while your exp is unlocked it will lock it.

Any further questions pm me.

Read full topic
